attributes.action: Pass a law making full disclosure of details of Bilderberg Meetings attended by MPs mandatory
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since 1954, over 130 individuals have met annually in secret locations both in Europe and the US.These meetings, called 
the Bilderberg group after the Hotel where the first meeting took place is also host to MPs from the UK. Discussions are held to set policy away from the view of the public. For the ordinary citizen it is next to impossible to find out what is discussed, certainly impossible to find details of conclusions or policies drawn. 
This is not how I define democracy, indeed it is its antithesis.
I urge, therefore, that the government passes a law making it mandatory for MPs 
who attend to report to Parliament and the public at large what was discussed, proposals and conclusions drawn.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
